feed.title: Bare Metal Cloud Status - Incident History

entry.title: [GRA, RBX, SBG, BHS / France, Canada][ Cisco ASA firewall] – Baremetal – Cisco ASA firewall – Planned Service End of Life
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Aug 31, 10:00 - 11:00 UTC

Dec 6, 12:21 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 28/02/2022 10:00 UTC
Service impact : As part of the product lifecycle management we plan to end the baremetal service of Cisco ASA firewall by August 31, 2022. This service interruption will concern only the customers who have previously subscribed to this service.
OVHcloud will decommission the service so that you won’t be able to connect to your Cisco ASA firewall from that date.
Please make the appropriate backup of your data prior that date.
---------------------------------------------------
Heure de début : 28/02/2022 10:00 UTC
Impact du service : Dans le cadre de la gestion du cycle de vie des produits, nous prévoyons de mettre fin au service baremetal du pare-feu Cisco ASA au 31 aout 2022. Cette interruption de service ne concernera que les clients qui ont précédemment souscrit à ce service.
OVHcloud mettra le service hors service de sorte que vous ne pourrez plus vous connecter à votre pare-feu Cisco ASA à partir de cette date.
Veuillez effectuer les sauvegardes appropriées de vos données avant cette date.

entry.title: [GRA7][VirtualPrivateServers] - RabbitMQ degradation
entry.content:
Jun 16, 01:41 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 16/06/2022 01:20 UTC
End time : 16/06/2022 01:37 UTC
Our technical teams resolved the issue. Servers can be manipulate (reboot, rebuild, ...) again !

Jun 16, 01:24 UTC
Identified - Start time : 16/06/2022 01:20 UTC
Service impact : The impacted servers cannot be manipulated (reboot, rebuild, ...).
Ongoing actions : Investigating
Servers continue to operate normally.
Our technical teams are working on resolving the issue. We post update as significant progress is made.

entry.title: [GRA2][Dedicated Servers] - G251
entry.content:
Jun 15, 15:22 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 15/06/2022 12:00 UTC
End Time : 15/06/2022 14:45 UTC
Root cause : The incident was caused by a anomaly in the electrical cabinet.
Comment : All impacted services are operational again, the incident is over. Further monitoring will be carried out over the next few hours.

Jun 15, 14:05 UTC
Update - Update : The resolution of the incident is still ongoing, the ETA provided is still maintained.

Jun 15, 13:19 UTC
Update - Update : Following further inspection, ETA for the intervention to bring the servers back into service has been reduced to approximately 2 hours from now.

Jun 15, 13:06 UTC
Identified - Update : A solution is being prepared to get the servers back up and running as soon as possible. ETA for this intervention 4 hours.
We will come back to you as soon as possible with new information.

Jun 15, 12:20 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 15/06/2022 12:00 UTC
Service impact : All racks on G251 are unreachable
Ongoing actions : Our teams are currently identifying the source of the incident.

entry.title: [GRA][BHS] [Data logs] Index backend migration
entry.content:
Jun 15, 13:40 UTC
Completed - Maintenance completed.
All data nodes has been migrated from Elasticsearch to OpenSearch. All kibana instances are moving to OpenSearch Dashboards one by one until tomorrow.

Jun 15, 12:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Apr 15, 00:08 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 15/06/2022 12:00 UTC
End time : 15/06/2022 15:00 UTC
Service impact : No downtime expected in term of log ingestion, but ES API will not be available for a maximum time of two hours.
Service improvement: The indexation backend of Logs Data Platform will be replaced from Elasticsearch to OpenSearch.
Kibana instances will be replaced by OpenSearch Dashboards ones.

APIv6 calls related to ElasticSearch backend will be automatically redirected to new OpenSearch backend and will remain available until September 2022.

The following documentation : https://docs.ovh.com/fr/logs-data-platform/ will be updated few days before the migration.

entry.title: [GRA2][Dedicated Servers] - G251A04/A05/A06
entry.content:
Jun 15, 12:30 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 15/06/2022 12:32 UTC

Root cause : Incident due to a tripped circuit breaker.

entry.title: [SBG3][Dedicated Servers] - S311B07
entry.content:
Jun 15, 12:30 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 15/06/2022 14:20 UTC
End Time : 15/06/2022 15:10 UTC
Service impacted : The servers in the S311B07 rack were unreachable.
